description: This dark-skinned elf stands in a battle-ready pose, her hair silver and eyes white and pupilless.

sections.body: Drow are skilled in the use of poison and never risk accidentally poisoning themselves. Drow favor an insidious toxin that causes its victims to lapse into unconsciousness—this poison allows drow to capture slaves with great ease.
sections.name: Poison Use

sections.body: Although related to the elves, the drow are a vile and evil cousin at best. Sometimes called dark elves, these cunning creatures prowl the caves and tunnels of the world below, ruling vast subterranean cities through fear and might. Worshiping demons and enslaving most races they encounter, the drow are among the underworld's most feared and hated denizens.

Drow are shorter and a bit more slender than their surface-dwelling kin, but they are otherwise physically similar. Drow have dark skin, ranging from black to a hazy purple hue. Most drow have white or silver hair and white or red eyes, but other colors are not unheard of.

Drow society is ruled over by powerful nobility, themselves governed by sadistic and dangerous matriarchs who constantly plot and scheme against rival houses and lesser kin within their own families. The majority of drow are the common soldiers and decadent citizenry, with base stats as presented here—drow nobles are more powerful and dangerous, and are detailed below.

In combat, drow are thoroughly ruthless, with little regard for fairness or mercy. They prefer to attack from ambush or to lure enemies into situations where they clearly have the upper hand. If things turn against them, drow are quick to flee, leaving slaves and minions to cover their escape.
Drow are defined by their class levels—they do not possess racial Hit Dice. All drow have the following racial traits.
sections.name: Drow

sections.body: Drow are Medium creatures, and have no bonuses or penalties due to their size.
sections.name: Medium

sections.body: Drow have a base speed of 30 feet.
sections.name: Normal Speed

sections.body: Drow can see in the dark up to 120 feet.
sections.name: Darkvision

sections.body: Drow are immune to magic sleep effects and get a +2 racial bonus to saves against enchantment spells.
sections.name: Drow Immunities

sections.body: Drow receive a +2 racial bonus on Perception checks.
sections.name: Keen Senses

sections.body: Drow possess spell resistance equal to 6 plus their class levels.
sections.name: Spell Resistance

sections.body: A drow can cast dancing lights, darkness, and faerie fire each once per day, using his total character level as his caster level.
sections.name: Spell-Like Abilities

sections.body: Abrupt exposure to bright light blinds drow for 1 round; on subsequent rounds, they are dazzled as long as they remain in the affected area.
sections.name: Light Blindness

sections.body: Drow are proficient with the hand crossbow, rapier, and short sword.
sections.name: Weapon Familiarity

sections.body: Drow begin play speaking Elven and Undercommon. Drow with high Intelligence can choose bonus languages from the following: Abyssal, Aklo, Aquan, Common, Draconic, Drow Sign Language, Gnome, or Goblin.
sections.name: Languages
